items.title: IDNO
items.help_text: Unique ID number for the document

items.title: Producers
items.help_text: List of producers

items.title: Date of production
items.help_text: Document production date - YYYY-MM-DD

items.title: Version statement
items.help_text: Version statement

items.title: Unique IDNO
items.help_text:
The ID number of a dataset is a unique number that is used to identify a particular survey. Define and use a consistent scheme to use. Such an ID could be constructed as follows: country-producer-survey-year-version where 
 - country is the 3-letter ISO country abbreviation 
 - producer is the abbreviation of the producing agency 
 - survey is the survey abbreviation 
 - year is the reference year (or the year the survey started) 
 - version is the number dataset version number (see Version Description below)

items.title: Title
items.help_text:
The title is the official name of the survey as it is stated on the questionnaire or as it appears in the design documents. The following items should be noted:
 - Include the reference year(s) of the survey in the title. 
 - Do not include the abbreviation of the survey name in the title. 
 - As the survey title is a proper noun, the first letter of each word should be capitalized (except for prepositions or other conjunctions).
 - Including the country name in the title is optional.

items.title: Alternate title
items.help_text: The abbreviation of a survey is usually the first letter of each word of the titled survey. The survey reference year(s) may be included.

items.title: Date of production
items.help_text: Date when the marked-up document source, data collection, other material(s) were produced (not distributed or archived). The ISO standard for dates (YYYY-MM-DD) is recommended for use with the date attribute.

items.title: roduction Place
items.help_text: Address of the archive or organization that produced the work

items.title: Funding
items.help_text: The source(s) of funds for production of the work. If different funding agencies sponsored different stages of the production process, use the 'role' attribute to distinguish them.

items.title: Distributors
items.help_text: The organization designated by the author or producer to generate copies of the particular work including any necessary editions or revisions. Names and addresses may be specified and other archives may be co-distributors. A URI attribute is included to provide an URN or URL to the ordering service or download facility on a Web site.

items.title: Version date
items.help_text: Version date in YYYY-MM-DD format

items.title: Version Responsibility Statement
items.help_text: The organization or person responsible for the version of the work

items.title: Bibliographic citations
items.help_text: Complete bibliographic reference containing all of the standard elements of a citation that can be used to cite the work. The `'bib_citation_format'` field is provided to enable specification of the particular citation style used, e.g., APA, MLA, Chicago, etc.

items.title: Citation Format
items.help_text: Specification of the particular citation style used, e.g., `APA`, `MLA`, `Chicago`, etc.

items.title: Bibliographic citation
items.help_text: Complete bibliographic reference containing all of the standard elements of a citation that can be used to cite the work. The `'bib_citation_format'` field is provided to enable specification of the particular citation style used, e.g., APA, MLA, Chicago, etc.

items.title: Holdings information
items.help_text: Information concerning either the physical or electronic holdings of the cited work. Attributes include: location--The physical location where a copy is held; callno--The call number for a work at the location specified; and URI--A URN or URL for accessing the electronic copy of the cited work.

items.title: Holdings information
items.help_text: Information concerning either the physical or electronic holdings of the cited work. Attributes include: location--The physical location where a copy is held; callno--The call number for a work at the location specified; and URI--A URN or URL for accessing the electronic copy of the cited work.
Provides structured information on the agency that authorized the study, the date of authorization, and an authorization statement
items.title: Study authorization
Authorization Statement
items.help_text: Authorization Statement
This section contains information about the data collection's scope across several dimensions, including substantive content, geography, and time.
items.title: Study information
Study budget
items.help_text: Provide a clear summary of the budget of the project in as much detail as needed.

items.title: Time periods
items.help_text: This field will usually be left empty. Time period differs from the dates of collection as they represent the period for which the data collected are applicable or relevant.

items.title: Geographic Bounding Polygon
items.help_text:
This field allows the creation of multiple polygons to describe in a more detailed manner the geographic area covered by the dataset. It should only be used to define the outer boundaries of a covered area. For example, in the United States, such polygons can be created to define boundaries for Hawaii, Alaska, and the continental United States, but not interior boundaries for the contiguous states. This field is used to refine a coordinate-based search, not to actually map an area. 
If the boundPoly element is used, then geoBndBox MUST be present, and all points enclosed by the boundPoly MUST be contained within the geoBndBox. Elements westBL, eastBL, southBL, and northBL of the geoBndBox should each be represented in at least one point of the boundPoly description.

lat.title: Latitude
lat.help_text: Latitude (y coordinate) of a point. Valid range expressed in decimal degrees is as follows: -90,0 to 90,0 degrees (latitude)

lon.title: longitude
lon.help_text: Longitude (x coordinate) of a point. Valid range expressed in decimal degrees is as follows: -180,0 to 180,0 degrees (longitude)

items.title: Geographic unit
items.help_text: Lowest level of geographic aggregation covered by the data

items.title: Quality statement
items.help_text: The quality statement provides elements to describe compliance with quality standards in the form of a statement and an itemized list of standards complied with, and an element to provide other quality statement.

items.title: Standards
items.help_text: Standards

items.title: Ex-Post Evaluation
items.help_text: This structure consists of two parts, standardsCompliance and otherQualityStatements. In standardsCompliance list all specific standards complied with during the execution of this study. Note the standard name and producer and how the study complied with the standard. Enter any additional quality statements in otherQualityStatements.

items.title: Study Development
items.help_text: Describe the process of study development as a series of development activities. These activities can be typed using a controlled vocabulary. Describe the activity, listing participants with their role and affiliation, resources used (sources of information), and the outcome of the development activity.

items.title: Time Method
items.help_text: The time method or time dimension of the data collection. Examples: `panel survey`, `h>cross-section`, `trend study`, `time-series`

items.title: Data collectors
items.help_text: The persons and.or agencies that took charge of the data collection. This element includes 3 fields: Name, Abbreviation and the Affiliation. In most cases, we will record here the name of the agency, not the name of interviewers. Only in the case of very small-scale surveys, with a very limited number of interviewers, the name of person will be included as well. The field Affiliation is optional and not relevant in all cases.

items.title: Collector training
items.help_text: Describes the training provided to data collectors including interviewer training, process testing, compliance with standards etc. This is repeatable for language and to capture different aspects of the training process. The type attribute allows specification of the type of training being described.

items.title: Frequency of Data Collection
items.help_text: For data collected at more than one point in time, the frequency with which the data were collected. Examples `monthly`, `quarterly`, `yearly`

items.title: Valid periods (YYYY.MM.DD)
items.help_text: Defines a time period for the validity of the sampling frame. Enter dates in YYYY-MM-DD format.

items.title: Custodian
items.help_text: Custodian identifies the agency or individual who is responsible for creating or maintaining the sample frame.

items.title: Universe
items.help_text: The group of persons or other elements that are the object of research and to which any analytic results refer.

items.title: Frame unit
items.help_text: Provides information about the sampling frame unit. The attribute `isPrimary` is boolean, indicating whether the unit is primary or not.

items.title: Unit type
items.help_text: Describes the type of sampling frame unit. The field `num_of_units` provides the number of units in the sampling frame.

items.title: Number of units
items.help_text: Number of units in the sampling frame

items.title: Reference periods (YYYY.MM.DD)
items.help_text: Indicates the period of time in which the sampling frame was actually used for the study in question. Use ISO 8601 date.time formats to enter the relevant date(s).

items.title: Update procedure
items.help_text: Description of how and with what frequency the sample frame is updated.

items.title: Deviations from the Sample Design
items.help_text:
This field only applies to sample surveys.
Sometimes the reality of the field requires a deviation from the sampling design (for example due to difficulty to access to zones due to weather problems, political instability, etc). If for any reason, the sample design has deviated, this should be reported here.

items.title: Mode of data collection
items.help_text: The mode of data collection is the manner in which the interview was conducted or information was gathered.  In most cases, the response will be 'face to face interview'. But for some specific kinds of datasets, such as for example data on rain fall, the response will be different.

items.title: Questionnaires
items.help_text:
The type of data collection instrument used. 
`Structured` indicates an instrument in which all respondents are asked the same questions.tests, possibly with precoded answers. If a small portion of such a questionnaire includes open-ended questions, provide appropriate comments. 
`Semi-structured` indicates that the research instrument contains mainly open-ended questions. 
`Unstructured` indicates that in-depth interviews were conducted.

items.title: Instrument development
items.help_text: Describe any development work on the data collection instrument. Type attribute allows for the optional use of a defined development type with or without use of a controlled vocabulary.

items.title: Instrument development type
items.help_text: Instrument development type

items.title: Notes on data collection
items.help_text: Description of noteworthy aspects of the data collection situation. Includes information on factors such as cooperativeness of respondents, duration of interviews, number of call-backs, etc.

items.title: Supervision
items.help_text: Summary of actions taken to minimize data loss. Includes information on actions such as follow-up visits, supervisory checks, historical matching, estimation, etc.

items.title: Control Operations
items.help_text: Methods to facilitate data control performed by the primary investigator or by the data archive. Specify any special programs used for such operations.

items.title: Weighting
items.help_text: The use of sampling procedures may make it necessary to apply weights to produce accurate statistical results. Describe here the criteria for using weights in analysis of a collection. If a weighting formula or coefficient was developed, provide this formula, define its elements, and indicate how the formula is applied to data.

items.title: Data Appraisal
items.help_text: Information about Data Appraisal

items.title: Class of the study
items.help_text: Generally used to give the data archive's class or study status number, which indicates the processing status of the study. May also be used as a text field to describe processing status. Example: `DDA Class C`, `Study is available from http:..example.com`

items.title: Data Processing
items.help_text: Describes various data processing procedures not captured elsewhere in the documentation, such as topcoding, recoding, suppression, tabulation, etc. The `type` attribute supports better classification of this activity, including the optional use of a controlled vocabulary

items.title: Coding Instructions
items.help_text: Describe specific coding instructions used in data processing, cleaning, assession, or tabulation.

command.title: Command
command.help_text: Provide command code for the coding instruction. The formalLanguage attribute identifies the language of the command code.

formal_language.title: Identify the language of the command code
formal_language.help_text: Identifies the language of the command code. e.g. `SPSS`, `R`, `STATA`

items.title: Data Set Availability
items.help_text: Information on availability and storage of the collection

items.title: Location of Data Collection
items.help_text: Location where the data collection is currently stored. Use the URL field `access_place_url` to provide a URN or URL for the storage site or the actual address from which the data may be downloaded

items.title: URL for Location of Data Collection
items.help_text: Location where the data collection is currently stored. Provide a URN or URL for the storage site or the actual address from which the data may be downloaded

items.title: Archive where study is originally stored
items.help_text: Archive from which the data collection was obtained; the originating archive

items.title: Availability Status
items.help_text: Statement of collection availability. An archive may need to indicate that a collection is unavailable because it is embargoed for a period of time, because it has been superseded, because a new edition is imminent, etc.

items.title: Extent of Collection
items.help_text: Summarizes the number of physical files that exist in a collection, recording the number of files that contain data and noting whether the collection contains machine-readable documentation and.or other supplementary files and information such as data dictionaries, data definition statements, or data collection instruments.

items.title: Completeness of Study Stored
items.help_text: This item indicates the relationship of the data collected to the amount of data coded and stored in the data collection. Information as to why certain items of collected information were not included in the data file stored by the archive should be provided

items.title: Number of Files
items.help_text: Total number of physical files associated with a collection

items.title: Notes
items.help_text: Notes and comments

items.title: Dataset use
items.help_text: Information on terms of use for the data collection

items.title: Confidentiality Declaration
items.help_text: This element is used to determine if signing of a confidentiality declaration is needed to access a resource.

required.title: Is signing of a confidentiality declaration required?
required.help_text: Is signing of a confidentiality declaration required

form_url.title: Confidentiality declaration form URL
form_url.help_text: Provide a URN or URL for online access to a confidentiality declaration form.

form_id.title: Form ID
form_id.help_text: Indicates the number or ID of the form that the user must fill out

items.title: Special Permissions
items.help_text: Determine if any special permissions are required to access a resource

required.title: Indicate if special permissions are required to access a resource
required.help_text: Indicate if special permissions are required to access a resource

form_id.title: Form ID
form_id.help_text: Indicates the number or ID of the form that the user must fill out

items.title: Restrictions
items.help_text: Any restrictions on access to or use of the collection such as privacy certification or distribution restrictions should be indicated here. These can be restrictions applied by the author, producer, or disseminator of the data collection. If the data are restricted to only a certain class of user, specify which type.

items.title: Deposit requirement
items.help_text: Information regarding user responsibility for informing archives of their use of data through providing citations to the published work or providing copies of the manuscripts.

items.title: Access conditions
items.help_text: Indicates any additional information that will assist the user in understanding the access and use conditions of the data collection.

items.title: Disclaimer
items.help_text: Information regarding responsibility for uses of the data collection

items.title: Notes
items.help_text: Notes and comments

items.title: Interval type
items.help_text: Indicates the interval type

items.title: Decimal points
items.help_text: Number of decimal points in the variable

items.title: Weight
items.help_text: Indicates whether the variable is a weight

items.title: Start position
items.help_text: Variable start position

items.title: End position
items.help_text: Variable end position

items.title: Width
items.help_text: Variable width

items.title: Record segment number
items.help_text: Record segment number, deck or card number the variable is located on (integer)

items.title: Summary statistics
items.help_text: One or more statistical measures that describe the responses to a particular variable and may include one or more standard summaries, e.g., minimum and maximum values, median, mode, etc.

items.title: Summary statistics
items.help_text: Standard category codes used in the variable, like industry codes, employment codes, or social class codes. The attribute date is provided to indicate the version of the code in place at the time of the study. The attribute URI is provided to indicate a URN or URL that can be used to obtain an electronic list of the category codes.
